question.text: A character is controlled by 5 alleles. How many genotypes are possible for this character?

solution.text: Irrespective of the phenotypes, genotypes are fixed for a given number of alleles in the population. The number of possible genotypes, in this case, would be <math><mn>15</mn><mo>.</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>=</mo></math> number of genotypes in a population. Where n is the number of alleles of that gene.
